title: Union Grove Baptist Church in South Chesterfield celebrating 146th anniversary
text: Union Grove Baptist Church in South Chesterfield celebrating 146th anniversary Comment By Contributed Report Posted Oct. 17, 2015 @ 2:00 am SOUTH CHESTERFIELD — Pastor William E. Johnson III and the Union Grove Baptist Church family invite the public to celebrate with them, 146 years of God's blessings. The church, located at 19111 Church Road, will observe the 2015 church anniversary on Sunday during the morning worship service. At 10:45 a.m., a testimony & praise time will be held; worship service will follow at 11. Guest preacher will be the Rev. Dr. Nathaniel D. West. Rev. West was born in Ruislip, England, and received his primary education in England, Turkey and Amarillo, Texas. His educational preparation at the post-secondary level includes a Bachelor of Science degree from Christopher Newport University in Newport News. Graduate studies include the Master of Divinity degree from Samuel Dewitt Proctor School of Theology, Virginia Union University, Richmond; Master of Arts degree in Christian Education; and a Ph.D. in Education from Virginia Commonwealth University. Dr. West is currently the director of Formation and Counseling and an assistant professor of Christian Education at Samuel Dewitt Proctor School of Theology, Virginia Union University in Richmond. The celebration continues at 3 p.m. with a Glory to God Praise Concert, which will be presented by singing messengers of God’s Word, The Senior Voices of Distinction – Petersburg & Vicinity. Senior Voices is directed by the Rev. Vernon “Billy” Lee, musical director and Reverend Karye Morgan, executive director. The concert will be: • An acknowledgement of present pastoral leadership, seasoned saints (65-97 years old), and members who continue to faithfully work in the vineyard. • A tribute to founders of Union Grove, former pastors, as well as faithful members who worked to the glory of God and have now transitioned to a new life. Minister Melissa Freeman, associate minister, Shiloh Baptist Church-South Chesterfield, will serve as praise/worship leader. Ushers from Shiloh and Union Branch Baptist churches-Chesterfield, will serve.
